original: Ericsson, Josef Emanuel, kyrkoherde, kontraktsprost, Dimboby, f. 4/3/83 i Barne-Äsaka, Skarab. 1., av August E. o. Matilda Johansson. G. 16 m. Henrietta Matilda Remper. Barn: Ulla Elisabet f. 23. ■— Stud:ex. i Upps. 07, teol. fil. ex. 08, teol. kand. 10, prästv. f. Skara stift 11. Pastorsadj. i Tidaholm 11, förste kommin. i V. Tunhem 12, kyrkoh. i Dimbo fr. 26, kontr :pro’St fr. 43. Ordf. i kyrkostämma i Hångsdala, Grästorp o. Ö’strä Ge-rumi, i ikyrkoifuililim. i Diimbo-Oittraviad, i Dimbo-Ottravads s^koddistr., i Hångs-dal-a skoldistr., ordf. i hemvärnet, ted. av fattigv:- O’. barnav:nd. Skr.: Pre-dikn. o. tidn:upps. LNO 44.
translated: Ericsson, Josef Emanuel, pastor, dean, Dimbo parish, born March 4th, 1883 in Barne-Äsaka, Skaraborg County, eldest son of August E. and Matilda Johansson. Married to Henrietta Matilda Remper in 1916, with whom he had a daughter named Ulla Elisabet, born in 1923. Completed his studies with a degree from Uppsala in 1907, followed by a theology degree in 1908, and ordination in the Skara diocese in 1911. Served as a curate in Tidaholm in 1911, then as a senior assistant pastor in Västra Tunhem in 1912, and finally as a parish priest in Dimbo from 1926, where he became the dean in 1943. He was also chairman of the church council in Hångsdala, Grästorp and Östra Gärnum, as well as in the church council in the Dimbo-Ottravads district, the Dimbo-Ottravads parish district, and the Hångsdala school district. He was the chairman of the home guard and appointed trustee of the poor and child welfare department. He also wrote religious sermons and articles for journals. Awarded the Order of the North Star in 1944.

structured.name: Josef Emanuel Ericsson
structured.description: Pastor and Dean of Dimbo parish

affiliation.name: Trustee of poor and child welfare department
